mdRecord.dcterms:title: San Francisco Plantation, interior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: The house became so distinctive that it inspired novelist Frances Parkinson Keyes to write "Steamboat Gothic", a story about the family she imagined lived there. Viewed from some angles, the house closely resembles the ornate and yet graceful superstructure of a Mississippi riverboat. -- http://www.sanfranciscoplantation.org/history.asp [work]
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Architecture and City Planning
